oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Hot Weather on Number of Visits to Water Troughs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Villarroel, A.
Krahn, B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: water consumption
milk production
environmental factors
ambient temperature
hot weather
heat stress
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Water consumption is crucial to maximum milk production. Environmental factors such as elevated ambient temperature influence water consumption, and therefore milk production. The objective of this study was to determine the effect of hot weather on water consumption, measured as number of visits to the water troughs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2010; 231
